etymology.description: Semantic: 日(日) (rì, "sun") + Phonetic: 免(免) (miǎn, "avoid") -> time after sunset -> evening
etymology.interpretation: 晚(晚) (wǎn, "evening; late") combines 日(日) (rì, "sun") to indicate the time of day, and 免(免) (miǎn, "avoid") as the phonetic component, suggesting the period when the sun is no longer visible.

examples.chinese: 太阳下山了(太陽下山了)，夜幕降临(夜幕降臨)。
examples.english: The sun has set, and the night has fallen.
